Bush,Monroe,Lighter Side Doctor,Regis Philbin,Dennis Rodman,Elton John,Courtney Love,Steven Tyler,Bruce Springsteen,White Spy,Bob Dole,Wes Craven,Roger Kaputnik,Lady Diana Spencer,Kathie Lee Gifford,Black Spy
ComicInfo.Title: The Malpractice; A New Millennium Update to Mad's Table of Little Known and Very Useless Weights, Measures and Distances; The Downside of Online Shopping; Monroe and… the Foreign Exchange Student; The Pokemon Collectors Hall of Fame; Bumper Stickers That Reflect Real School Life; The Ex-Files; One Fine Day in the Animal Testing Lab; The Lighter Side of...; Mad's Commencement Address for the Class of 2000; Mad Anagrams; A Mad Look at Parents; Mad's Celebrity Cause-Of-Death Betting Odds; Magnetic Personality
ComicInfo.Summary:
Parody of TV's The Practice.
Gags featuring Measurements of pop icons and others.
Satire featuring why not to shop online.
Monroe goes to China on a foreign exchange program and gets put to hard labor, while his mom is living it up with Hung Lo, the Chinese exchange student.
Honoring the losers who bought into the Pokemon fad.
Honest Bumper Sticker gags.
Regular one page Duck Edwing "Tales From The Duck Side" feature.
A cynical look at justice, celebrity, parents, pets, cell phones, desire, finances, relationships, business, therapy, the office, power, and doctors.
What they are really telling you at your graduation.
Another installment of the regular Spy VS. Spy feature.
Anagrams that tell a lot about celebrities.
Sergio Aragones Parent themed gags.
Odds on how a celeb will bite the big one.
ComicInfo.Writer: Josh Gordon,J. Prete,John Caldwell,Anthony Barbieri,Mike Snider,Jeff Kruse,Duck Edwing,Michael Gallagher,Dave Berg,Peter Kuper,Sergio Aragonés
ComicInfo.Penciller: Mort Drucker,Bob Staake,John Caldwell,Bill Wray,R. J. Matson,Paul Coker,Duck Edwing,Dave Berg,Tom Bunk,Peter Kuper,Sam Sisco,Sergio Aragonés,Hermann Mejia
ComicInfo.Inker: Mort Drucker,Bob Staake,John Caldwell,Bill Wray,R. J. Matson,Paul Coker,Duck Edwing,Dave Berg,Tom Bunk,Peter Kuper,Sam Sisco,Sergio Aragonés,Hermann Mejia
